comments:
Bugzilla mid-air collision errors should not be dumped to the log. If this stuff shown
to the user there is no point to pollute the log.


-- Error Log --
Date: Mon Dec 04 16:04:58
EST 2006
Message: Failed to submit to repository: Changes may not have successfully committed.
Posting
to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs failed: A mid-air collision has occurred. Please synchronize
by selecting Synchronize in the task's context menu.

Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core
Stack
Trace:
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaException: A mid-air collision
has occurred. Please synchronize by selecting Synchronize in the task's context menu.
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.parseHtmlError(BugzillaClient.java:979)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.postTaskData(BugzillaClient.java:755)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaTaskDataHandler.postTaskData(BugzillaTaskDataHandler.java:145)
	at
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.editors.AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor$31.run(AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor.java:2488)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Yes, actually this might be a candidate for opening the web dialog.
Yes, we used to do that and it's probably the better option.

traces.message: A mid-air collision has occurred. Please synchronize by selecting Synchronize in the task's context menu.
